The '''Palace of Alcazarzaray''' is a location in [[Sumeru]].

==Characters==
* [[Dori]]: Merchant

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
*An ''{{w|alcázar}}'' is a type of Islamic palace built in the {{w|al-Andalus}} region. ''Alcázar'' is a Spanish word derived from the Arabic {{lang|mini=1|ar=القصر|ar_rm=al-qaṣr}}, meaning "fort" or "palace," which itself is derived from the Latin word ''castrum'', meaning "fortress" or "military camp."
**The derivation of ''-zaray'' is unclear. It may be derived from the Arabic word {{lang|mini=1|ar=زَرَعَ|ar_rm=zaraʿa}}, meaning "to plant" or "to sow." Alternately, it could be {{lang|mini=1|ar=زَرْعَيْ|ar_rm=zarʿay}}, a declension of {{lang|mini=1|ar=زَرَعَ|ar_rm=zar'}}, which can mean "seed" or "field." It is also an Arabic or Persian name meaning "to shine, brilliant, bright, blooming flower, to grow, to sow."
*In the Chinese name, {{lang|mini=1|zh=卡萨扎莱|zh_rm=Kǎsàzhālái}} appears to be a phonetic transcription of ''qaṣr'' and ''zaray'', as explained above. The {{lang|mini=1|zh={{wt|萊|莱|Chinese}}|zh_rm=lái}} character can refer to the {{w|goosefoot}} plant, weeds, or fallow (unseeded) fields.
